import React from "react"; const Projectspotifyrecentlyadded = () => { return (
View Project

About this project

Before I was introduced to Spotify, I listened to all my music on the iTunes app. One feature I enjoyed was the 'Recently Added' playlist, that iTunes auto-generates based on the top 20 tracks you most recently added to your music library.

Spotify doesn't offer this feature, but I was excited to find that they have a really well-documented API for developers to use.

I took a stab at it, and ended up with a functional app that at the moment serves only one happy user: me :) ! And which is probably a good thing, as it does use a personal developer key I had to register with Spotify in order to use their API.

The biggest challenge I had during this app was figuring out how the Spotify authentication worked. It took me a while to figure out that I had to first log in with the developer key, and then redirect back to the app and fetch the new code from the url, and finally, use that code to make requests to the API.

After I had figured that out, it was straight-forward, figuring out how to get a user's latest tracks and then creating a new playlist from them. I also had some fun playing around with animations and the UI of the app. I added some interactive elements, and allowed the user to customize the number of tracks they want in their new playlist.

); }; export default Projectspotifyrecentlyadded;
